content: A place for everything, everything in its place.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: In oneself lies the whole world and if you know how to look and learn, the door is there and the key is in your hand. Nobody on earth can give you either the key or the door to open, except yourself.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

content: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

content: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas A. Edison

content: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
author: Plato

content: Show me your hands. Do they have scars from giving? Show me your feet. Are they wounded in service? Show me your heart. Have you left a place for divine love?
author: Fulton J. Sheen

content: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfilment.
author: Tony Robbins

content: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
author: Wilma Rudolph

content: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?

content: You change your life by changing your heart.

content: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.

content: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
author: Ben Okri

content: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.

content: With self-discipline most anything is possible.

content: The only journey is the one within.

content: Belief creates the actual fact.
author: William James

content: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

content: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

content: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
author: Michael Jackson

content: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
author: Hosea Ballou

content: We have it in our power to begin the world over again.
author: Thomas Paine

content: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
author: Han Suyin

content: A man has to learn that he cannot command things, but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others, but that he can mold and master his own will: and things serve him who serves Truth; people seek guidance of him who is master of himself.
author: James Allen

content: If it were not for hopes, the heart would break.
author: Thomas Fuller

content: Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
author: Amelia Barr

content: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: When deeds speak, words are nothing.

content: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
author: Sylvester Stallone

content: As knowledge increases, wonder deepens.
author: Charles Morgan

content: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

content: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
author: Meister Eckhart

content: Each day provides its own gifts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

content: It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.

content: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.

content: And now, this is the sweetest and most glorious day that ever my eyes did see.

content: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.

content: Great hopes make great men.

content: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.

content: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.

content: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.

content: Think with your whole body.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

content: Ideas shape the course of history.

content: Honesty is the best policy.

author: Abraham Maslow

author: Walter Lippmann

author: Archimedes

content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.

author: Ayn Rand

author: Saint Augustine

content: It is said that heaven does not create one man above or below another man. Any existing distinction between the wise and the stupid, between the rich and the poor, comes down to a matter of education.
author: Fukuzawa Yukichi

content: Each individual man and each individual country, according to the principles of natural reason, is free from bondage. Consequently, if there is some threat that might infringe upon a country’s freedom, then that country should not hesitate even to take up arms against all the countries of the world.
author: Fukuzawa Yukichi

content: In its broad sense, civilization means not only comfort in daily necessities but also the refining of knowledge and the cultivation of virtue so as to elevate human life to a higher plane.
author: Fukuzawa Yukichi

content: Once the wind of Western civilization blows to the East, every blade of grass and every tree in the East follow what the Western wind brings... We do not have time to wait for the en­lightenment of our neighbors so that we can work together toward the development of Asia. It is better for us to leave the ranks of Asian na­tions and cast our lot with civilized nations of the West... We should deal with them exactly as the Westerners do.
author: Fukuzawa Yukichi

content: Robbery and murder are the worst of human crimes; but in the West there are robbers and murderers. There are those who form cliques to vie for the reins of power and who, when deprived of that power, decry the injustice of it all. Even worse, international diplomacy is really based on the art of deception. Surveying the situation as a whole, all we can say is that there is a general prevalence of good over bad, but we can hardly call the situation perfect. When, several thousand years hence, the levels of knowledge and virtue of the peoples of the world will have made great progress (to the point of becoming utopian), the present condition of the nations of the West will surely seem a pitifully primitive stage. Seen in this light, civilization is an open-ended process. We cannot be satisfied with the present level of attainment of the West.
author: Fukuzawa Yukichi

content: There isn't time, so brief is life, for bickering, apologies, heartburning, callings to account. There is only time for loving, and but an instant, so to speak, for that.
author: Mark Twain
